intro: Bauhinia hookeri var. broomensis, commonly known as the broome bauhinia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive bipinnate leaves and showy, butterfly-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. It is often found in the northern regions of Western Australia, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained environments.
